questions.question: How are reflecting telescopes different from refracting telescopes?

choices.answer: reflecting magnify objects, refracting minimize them
Reflecting magnify space items, refracting  only Earth items
Reflecting use mirrors, refracting use lenses

questions.question: How many lenses are found in the simplest telescopes?
What part of a reflecting telescope would you measure to find the aperture
What can you infer about a telescope with a large aperture?

choices.answer: images are brighter and clearer than other telescopes
can magnify things further away than other telescopes
can magnify smaller objects than other telescopes
its eyepiece is much smaller other telescopes

questions.question: A telescope that can enlarge images from very far away has high
Which of the following a a type of simple telescope?
Why is the Hubble telescope located in space?

choices.answer: So its images aren't distorted by Earth's atmosphere
So it can be closer to the stars it magnifies
So it can emit radio waves
So it can be operated by astronauts

questions.question: What is true about ALL radio telescopes?

choices.answer: They have very large optical lenses
They magnify things that can't be seen with the naked eye
They broadcast images over the radio

questions.question: What do x-rays, visible light, gamma rays, and radio waves have in common?

choices.answer: They can all be seen with optical telescopes
They are all types of electromagnetic radiation
They can all be seen with the naked eye
They are all part of the periodic table of elements
